content:
# The furnace was initially out of coal, but I successfully inserted more coal, bringing the total to 50 units in the furnace. 
# Additionally, I inserted 10 Iron Ore into the furnace for smelting.

# The furnace is currently in a "WORKING" state, indicating that it is processing the Iron Ore into Iron Plates. 
# I will now monitor the output of the furnace to ensure that the Iron Plates are being produced.

# To check the status of the smelting process, I will wait for a few seconds and then check the inventory of Iron Plates.
# I will implement a wait logic to allow for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time of 30 seconds
    current_iron_plate_count = inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0)  # Check the count of Iron Plates
    if current_iron_plate_count >= 71:  # Check if we have produced at least 10 additional Iron Plates
        print("Sufficient Iron Plates are ready.")
        break 
    sleep(1)  # Wait for 1 second before checking again
else:
    print("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # Timeout check failed

# After the wait, I will log the final inventory status and the state of the entities on the map.
final_inventory_status = inspect_inventory()  # Final inventory check
print(f"Final Inventory Status: {final_inventory_status}")  # Log this status to confirm counts
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Log the current state of entities in the game.
